activities.title: Cascade Mountain Trail Hike
activities.short_description: A popular 4.8-mile round trip hike offering spectacular views of the Adirondack High Peaks region.
activities.long_description: Cascade Mountain is one of the most popular hikes in the Adirondack High Peaks region, and for good reason. The 4.8-mile round trip offers spectacular 360-degree views and is considered a great introduction to the High Peaks for novice hikers. The trail ascends 1,940 feet and follows a well-worn path through northern hardwood forest. The upper portion of the trail opens to bare rock with increasingly panoramic views. The summit is completely bare and offers unobstructed views in all directions.

activities.title: Central Park Bike Tour
activities.short_description: A scenic 6-mile bike ride through New York's iconic Central Park with stops at famous landmarks.
activities.long_description: Experience the beauty of Central Park on two wheels with this guided 6-mile bike tour. The route takes you through the park's most scenic paths, stopping at famous landmarks including Bethesda Fountain, Strawberry Fields, and the Jackie Kennedy Onassis Reservoir. Perfect for families and riders of all skill levels, this tour provides a unique perspective on one of New York City's most beloved green spaces. Bikes and safety equipment are provided, and the gentle terrain makes this accessible for children and adults alike.

activities.title: Kayaking on Lake George
activities.short_description: Paddle through the crystal-clear waters of Lake George, surrounded by the Adirondack Mountains.
activities.long_description: Lake George offers some of the most pristine kayaking waters in the Northeast. This guided kayaking adventure takes you along the shoreline of the 'Queen of American Lakes,' with its crystal-clear waters and stunning mountain backdrop. Explore hidden coves, small islands, and see historic sites from a unique water-level perspective. The tour includes all necessary equipment and basic instruction, making it suitable for beginners while still offering enough exploration to satisfy experienced paddlers. Wildlife sightings, including eagles and ospreys, are common during the warmer months.
